annotation.TEXT: The spell books create platforms once you hit them in any way, but they only last for a few moments. Fortunately, hitting the spell book again resets the timer for them (which is necessary for the next room).
Note: Voting has ended for this video. Please do not send any more votes through the comments section.

Chester will sell you the Flare Wand in this stage for 1,000 gold. The Flare Wand itself fires out a projectile straight ahead that does minimal damage (enemies can also cancel out the projectile with their own shots as well). While it's not overly helpful in most situations, it can prove effective for taking out enemies at a distance that the Chaos Sphere can't reach.

There's actually a secret here you can reach by bouncing off the flying...weasels? Or are they rats? In either case, the upper path leads to a room filled with extra gold and gems (but nothing necessary for the sake of a 100% run).

Time to move on to the other main stage. King Knight's stage seems to be the one most people start off with, and for a few understandable reasons: It's marginally easier than Specter Knight's stage, it has no major traps in it, and it has quite a bit of gold. The only really tricky thing about this stage is the easy to miss secret at the very beginning.

These knights are a fair bit smarter than some of the other enemies seen so far. They'll actually adjust their shields in accordance to how you attack them (they'll either back up or block a normal attack, or they'll hold their shield straight up if you attempt to use a down-thrust on them). Personally, I try not to bother with these guys unless it's an absolute necessity to take them down (then again, they do tend to give out a decent amount of gold if you manage to kill them).

Pits with sparkling lights indicate there's something you can obtain from them by using the fishing rod. Most of the time you'll get a golden fish (which is worth 350 gold). At other times, you might find a Troupple Fish, who will give you a random Ichor for your chalice if you have an empty one on-hand. Beyond that, there's also a few music sheets you can fish out in specific levels, but these are usually only found in secret areas.

King Knight is probably the easiest out of the main bosses. He'll tend to jump a few times (usually 2 or so) before attempting to dash across the screen or hit you with his scepter. He also has a move where he summons trumpets to rain down "deadly confetti" on you (but he leaves himself wide open in the process). The only really dangerous thing about him is his ground-slam move, which will stun you if you don't jump at the right time.
